ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Save every command typed in a Sherpa or ChIPS session to a file.

DESC.PARA: The script function saves every command typed in a Sherpa session to the file specified in the 'filename' argument; by default, the file "sherpa.log" is used. Note that this command saves only the existing history of the session - i.e., everything typed up until the script command is called - and does not log new commands.
The script command is also available in ChIPS. In that program, the default filename is "chips.log".

LIST.ITEM: filename - the name of the file to write; default = sherpa.log

DESC.PARA: This command will record *everything* typed at the command line in a Sherpa session to the file "sherpa_session1.log", unless this filename already exists in the current working directory.
DESC.VERBATIM:
sherpa> script("sherpa_session1.log") IOError: script file sherpa_session1.log exists and clobber is not set.
sherpa> script("sherpa_session1.log", True)

DESC.PARA: When issued with no arguments, the 'script' command writes to "sherpa.log"; clobber is turned off by default.
DESC.VERBATIM:
sherpa> script() # sherpa.log created
sherpa> script() IOError: script file sherpa.log exists and clobber is not set.
